title: SEC504: Hacker Tools, Techniques, and Incident Handling
description: Master real-world incident response through hands-on labs, AI-powered analysis, and attacker mindset training. AI doesn't change the need for expertise—it raises the bar for what expertise looks like.

title: FOR508: Advanced Incident Response, Threat Hunting, and Digital Forensics
description: Learn the advanced incident response and threat hunting skills you need to identify, counter, and recover from a wide range of threats within enterprise networks.

title: SEC401: Security Essentials - Network, Endpoint, and Cloud
description: Gain essential cybersecurity skills to quickly detect, respond to, and remediate threats. Learn how to protect critical information and technology assets, whether on-premises or in the cloud.

title: SEC275: Foundations: Computers, Technology, & Security
description: Build your cybersecurity confidence from the ground up. This SANS Foundations course gives you the essential skills, tools, and mindset to launch your journey into the world of cyber.

title: SEC560: Enterprise Penetration Testing
description: Learn enterprise-scale penetration testing; identify, exploit, and assess real business risks across on-prem, Azure, and Entra ID environments through hands-on labs and an intensive CTF.

title: LDR512: Security Leadership Essentials for Managers
description: Gain essential technical and leadership skills to effectively manage security programs, covering key topics like security architecture, vulnerability management, cloud security, and GenAI security.

title: LDR514: Security Strategic Planning, Policy, and Leadership
description: This course offers an MBA-level approach, preparing cybersecurity leaders to build strategic plans, craft effective policies, and lead across technical and business teams.

title: FOR578: Cyber Threat Intelligence
description: Master tactical, operational, and strategic cyber threat intelligence skills. Improve analytic processes and incident response effectiveness to support your detection and response programs.

title: SEC595: Applied Data Science and AI/Machine Learning for Cybersecurity Professionals
description: Acquire practical data science and machine learning skills to build custom AI-driven security solutions that transform your organization's threat detection capabilities.

title: ICS410: ICS/SCADA Security Essentials
description: Reinforce critical cybersecurity skills to secure industrial control systems and operational technology against emerging threats while maintaining operational resilience in industrial environments.

title: FOR500: Windows Forensic Analysis
description: Gain an essential understanding of Windows artifacts and learn to perform digital forensics in Microsoft Windows operating systems to recover, analyze, and authenticate data and solve a forensic case.

title: SEC530: Defensible Security Architecture and Engineering: Implementing Zero Trust for the Hybrid Enterprise
description: Achieve a holistic approach to defensible security architecture and engineering. Master tactics from network segmentation to conditional access and privileged identity controls under Zero Trust.

title: SEC503: Network Monitoring and Threat Detection In-Depth
description: Gain technical knowledge in network monitoring and threat detection. Learn to identify emerging threats, perform large-scale correlation for threat hunting, and reconstruct network attacks.

title: ICS310: ICS Cybersecurity Foundations
description: Gain foundational ICS and OT security knowledge and hands-on experience in this one-day course.

title: SEC497: Practical Open-Source Intelligence (OSINT)
description: Learn to perform effective, secure OSINT research with practical techniques. Explore critical OSINT tools and apply your skills in hands-on labs based on real-world scenarios.

title: AIS247: AI Security Essentials for Business Leaders
description: Equip yourself to navigate the AI revolution securely with strategies that maximize productivity gains while minimizing associated risks in your enterprise.

title: ICS515: ICS Visibility, Detection, and Response
description: Acquire critical visibility, detection, and response capabilities to protect ICS/OT environments against sophisticated threats while ensuring the safety and reliability of operations.

title: SEC542: Web App Penetration Testing and Ethical Hacking
description: Build real-world web app offensive skills with a hands-on, repeatable process for finding, exploiting, and clearly proving the vulnerabilities that matter.

title: FOR572: Advanced Network Forensics: Threat Hunting, Analysis, and Incident Response
description: Deepen your advanced network forensics experience, including threat hunting, analysis, and incident response. Explore the tools, technology, and processes needed to integrate network evidence sources.

description: Explore malware analysis tools and techniques in depth and acquire the practical skills to examine malicious programs that target and infect Windows systems.

title: SEC502: Cloud Security Tactical Defense
description: Gain tactical skills to configure, monitor, and defend cloud environments while addressing data security and compliance challenges.

title: SEC540: Cloud Native Security and DevSecOps Automation
description: Gain the skills and methodology to secure modern Cloud Native, DevSecOps, and Kubernetes environments through hands-on labs using security controls in CI/CD pipelines for cloud systems.

title: SEC511: Cybersecurity Engineering: Advanced Threat Detection and Monitoring
description: Learn cutting-edge cybersecurity engineering and advanced threat detection skills for cloud, network, and endpoint environments in this comprehensive course.

title: FOR509: Enterprise Cloud Forensics and Incident Response
description: Cloud forensics is evolving. FOR509 equips examiners to embrace new evidence sources in enterprise cloud environments instead of forcing outdated on-premise methods.

title: SEC549: Cloud Security Architecture
description: Learn to design enterprise-ready, scalable cloud solutions for your organization. Engage in threat modeling and secure architecture review labs to experience the cloud migration journey.

title: SEC301: Introduction to Cyber Security
description: SEC301 introduces cybersecurity fundamentals for non-technical professionals, empowering them to understand risks, terminology, and best practices to support security in any role.

title: LDR553: Cyber Incident Management
description: Develop essential leadership skills to effectively manage cyber incidents from discovery to resolution, providing clear direction when your organization needs it most.

description: Secure the full GenAI lifecycle, mastering hands-on strategies to defend LLMs, agents, and RAG-powered apps from development to deployment.

description: Learn how we can leverage Agentic AI development and Python as security professionals. From the Python essentials to developing AI Agents for your own information security tools.

description: This course delivers essential training for Security Operations Center (SOC) analysts, equipping you with the skills to detect, stop cyberattacks, and safeguard your organization’s data and systems.

title: FOR585: Smartphone Forensic Analysis In-Depth
description: Your forensic tools report data—but they cannot determine if the user created it. Learn to validate mobile artifacts, recover evidence tools miss, and testify with confidence in court.

description: This intensive three-day course prepares you to build a mature awareness program, providing you with the roadmap, skills, and lessons learned on how to effectively manage and measure your organization’s human risk.

title: FOR608: Enterprise-Class Incident Response & Threat Hunting
description: Learn to identify and respond to enterprise-class incidents. Deepen your threat hunting abilities using enterprise-class tools and digging into analysis methodologies to understand attacker movement.

description: Learn practical skills to build secure, effective Large Language Model (LLM) solutions using Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) in this fully hands-on course.

description: Cloud security starts with thinking like the adversary—hack, test, and assess cloud environments built from real-world attacks.

description: Acquire elite cloud threat detection capabilities to identify, analyze, and respond to sophisticated attacks in AWS and Azure environments.

description: Learn to comprehensively assess and test the security of iOS and Android devices and applications through hands-on analysis and penetration testing techniques.

description: Integrate strategic and tactical approaches to level up enterprise vulnerability management programs while addressing infrastructure and cloud environment challenges.

description: Transform your cybersecurity leadership by gaining financial literacy that helps you understand business health, communicate effectively with finance teams, and demonstrate value to your organization.

title: LDR419: Performing A Cybersecurity Risk Assessment
description: Explore industry-leading strategies for conducting cybersecurity risk assessments that deliver actionable insights to protect your organization's critical assets and meet regulatory requirements.

description: SEC556 equips security professionals with comprehensive skills to identify, assess, and exploit IoT device security mechanisms across diverse technological ecosystems.

title: ICS612: ICS Cybersecurity In-Depth

description: Advanced purple team training empowers security professionals to simulate sophisticated threat actor techniques through comprehensive adversary emulation across complex enterprise environments.

description: Sharpen elite professional security skills forging stealthy Windows implants, customized shellcode, and command and control frameworks that evade contemporary defenses.
